thread.title: Will Pullman and the WSU Cougars get ESPN’s College GameDay?
thread.title_full: Will Pullman and the WSU Cougars get ESPN’s College GameDay? | The Seattle Times

author: Stefanie Loh
title: Will Pullman and the WSU Cougars get ESPN’s College GameDay?
text:
As soon as the Cougars dispatched with Arizona 45-42 on Saturday evening, all attention turned to ESPN’s College GameDay, specifically, College GameDay’s Twitter feed, which is how the show is supposed to announce what its location will be for the Oct. 31. Halloween edition.
In the week leading up to the Arizona game, ESPN confirmed that Pullman was one of eight finalists for the Oct. 31 show. College GameDay has never been to Pullman. ESPN Director of Public Relations Keri Potts told the Seattle Times earlier this week that the show usually makes a decision on its next location by Sunday mornings at the latest.
But as of Sunday morning, fans are still waiting for a College GameDay location announcement. The show is believed to be deciding between Philadelphia, Pa. — for the Notre Dame vs. Temple game — and Pullman, where WSU will play Stanford in a game that could decide the Pac-12 North. A report surfaced Saturday morning that the show had decided to go to Philadelphia, but an ESPN spokesperson confirmed Saturday evening that it had yet to make a decision. on the location for next week’s show.
College GameDay, which was at James Madison University in Harrisonburg, Va. over the weekend, has been conspicuously quiet since Saturday night, however, and the silence has sent both Temple and WSU fans into a tizzy.
Most Read Stories Seattle principal losing his job over unfinished teacher evaluations Seattle Seahawks' Kam Chancellor takes to Twitter to protest fine from NFL 5 ways CaliBurger is better than In-N-Out Seattle Mariners manager Scott Servais may not be a sexy hire, but is he the right one? Sports on TV & radio Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. Fans from both sides have been tweeting at the CollegeGameDay account since Saturday afternoon. They’ve also bombarded the twitter accounts of GameDay personalities Lee Corso, Rece Davis, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard. But so far, aside from Herbstreit retweeting one Coug fan’s entreaty to come to Pullman for GameDay, the four hosts have been silent on the matter since Saturday night.
Just imagine the crowd if you came to @WSUPullman . #WSU #GoCougs https://t.co/Zk9KP0Omit 
— WSU Pullman (@WSUPullman) October 25, 2015 
Hey @CollegeGameDay I really want you to come to Pullman, but I'd also love it if you'd put us out of our misery either way. Go Cougs
— PJ Kendall (@Deathby105) October 25, 2015 
. @CollegeGameDay Bring #CollegeGameday to the flag! #GoCougs @WSUCougars pic.twitter.com/FAK1DRvNzQ 
— Butch T. Cougar (@ButchTCougar) October 25, 2015 
@espn @CollegeGameDay @ESPNStatsInfo @KirkHerbstreit @jaymee @WSUPullman next Saturday is really self explanatory pic.twitter.com/33vniF0nOM 
— Alex Mueller (@AlexMueller23) October 25, 2015 
Getting to PA from @JMUSports is easy, so the delay from @CollegeGameDay would appear to signal a real effort by @leefitting to get to #WSU 
— Coug-A-Sutra (@CougSutra) October 25, 2015 
Cougar Nation waiting for @CollegeGameDay to make a decision. #WSU #GoCougs pic.twitter.com/z4gRNSlTOo 
— WSU Pullman (@WSUPullman) October 25, 2015 
Just sitting over here waiting to see if @CollegeGameDay is headed to Philadelphia!

 @TempleOwls @Temple_FB pic.twitter.com/yTSSpUYHGP 
— American Football (@American_FB) October 25, 2015 
. @CollegeGameDay does Temple have one of these on your campus? Nope. #bringgamedaytopullman @olcrimson #GoCougs pic.twitter.com/L1YuftUiDx 
— Myk Crawford (@mykcrawford) October 25, 2015 
Hey @leefitting @CollegeGameDay , Temple and all of Philadelphia will give you the best Gameday you've ever had. #TUFB4gameday 
— Maxwell (@Max_Rizer) October 25, 2015 
Let's hope @CollegeGameDay doesn't #CougIt and go to @Temple_FB instead of Pullman. #GoCougs 
— JJ Powell (@JJPowell3) October 25, 2015 
Was just told by @espn that there is no set time to announce the College GameDay location. Hang in there Temple fans.
— Marc Narducci (@sjnard) October 25, 2015 
Stefanie Loh : sloh@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @StefanieLoh . Stef Loh has covered college football in four conferences on both coasts, but her heart has always been rooted in the Pacific Northwest. She joined The Seattle Times in August 2015. She loves wine tasting, Olympic weightlifting, fall colors and college football Saturdays.
